# Introduction

# Data Carpentry and Metadata

We first investigate the available metadata to get an feeling for the overall sample composition and quality.

```{r}
meta.all_study_list <- readxl::read_excel("Data/Metadata/ALLStudy1_Liste_total.xlsx", sheet = "final", skip = 3) %>% 
  tibble::repair_names() -> meta.all_study_list

meta.all_study_list %>% glimpse()

meta.all_study_list %>% 
  dplyr::select(Subtyp, LaufNr, viability, `alive cells...13`, `BLASTS 08.04.`, `NEW CD19+`, `conc [Âµg/mL]`) %>% 
  dplyr::rename("ID" = "LaufNr",
                "total_cells_alive" = "alive cells...13",
                "blast_percentage" = "BLASTS 08.04",
                "cd19_percentage")

```
